**Skylar J. Laursen** is a Ph.D candidate enrolled in the Neuroscience and Applied Cognitive Science program in the [Department of Psychology](https://www.uoguelph.ca/psychology/) at the [University of Guelph](https://www.uoguelph.ca) (located in Guelph, Ontario, Canada). I am completing my thesis in the [Guelph Memory and Cognition Lab](https://fiacconi-lab.uoguelph.ca) under the supervision of [Dr. Chris Fiacconi](https://www.uoguelph.ca/psychology/users/chris-fiacconi). Broadly, my research is focused on the interaction between metacognitive monitoring and control of learning. I also completed a practicum under the supervision of [Dr. Harvey Marmurek](https://www.uoguelph.ca/psychology/users/harvey-marmurek) at the University of Guelph, focused on test-potentiated new learning.

I am a University of Guelph alumna (B.Sc. Honours Psychology: Brain and Cognition 2019, minors in Neuroscience, and Criminal Justice and Public Policy & M.Sc. Psychology 2021). I completed both my undergraduate and Master's theses at the Guelph Memory and Cognition Lab under the supervision of Dr. Chris Fiacconi. My Bachelorâ€™s research focus was on the [contribution of perceptual fluency to judgments of learning](https://doi.org/10.1037/xlm0000766).

You can find my full CV [here](CV.pdf).
